document_data.name: ''Larloch's Soul Stealer''
document_data.creator: [[Larloch]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Larloch's Soul Stealer''''' was a powerful and deadly [[ring]] [[enchanted]] by the [[lich]] [[Larloch]] himself.
document_data.Powers: ''Larloch's Soul Stealer'' allowed the wearer to cast the ''[[circle of death]]'' and ''[[finger of death]]'' [[spell]]s at will. Each spell consumed a single charge stored within the item, and the ring held ten charges at a time.
document_data.History: ''Larloch's Soul Stealer'' was created by the infamous [[necromancer]] and lich, Larloch. The ring was used to harvest souls for the [[undead]] mage's magical experiments. At some point before the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, ''Larloch's Soul Stealer'' was accepted by [[Mintassan]] the Magnificent. The planeswalking [[wizard]] added the precious ring to his collections of curios from across the worlds, displayed in [[Mintassan's Mysteries]], his site on Westgate's [[Market Triangle]]. Mintassan warned the uninitiated to dabble with the ring's dangerous magics at their own peril.
